meanings.definition: A delusional disorder in which a person believes that another person, typically of higher social status, is in love with them.
meanings.sent1: Her erotomania made her think the president was secretly in love with her.
meanings.sent2: The psychiatrist diagnosed him with erotomania after he claimed a celebrity was in love with him.
meanings.sent3: Despite his erotomania, he never missed a chance to ask for the autograph of the famous actress.
meanings.sent4: Her erotomania painted a colorful but false picture of a romantic relationship with the wealthy businessman.
meanings.sent5: The erotomania clouded her judgment, leading her to believe in a love that was never there.

meanings.definition: The delusional belief that one is loved by another person, often of a higher social status.
meanings.sent1: His erotomania convinced him that the queen had feelings for him.
meanings.sent2: People suffering from erotomania often write love letters to famous personalities.
meanings.sent3: Despite his erotomania, he never missed a chance to ask for the autograph of the famous actress.
meanings.sent4: The erotomania painted a false image of a grand love affair with the celebrity.
meanings.sent5: The intensity of his erotomania made him blind to the reality of the situation.
